title: Grizzco Splatana

The Grizzco Splatana is a Salmon Run Next Wave rare weapon in Splatoon 3. It appears to be an illegitimately modified[1] Splatana Stamper.

The weapon is a short-ranged splatana that does not send out ink "beams" and only covers a small area of ground in front of the user, limiting its use to melee combat. It is an extremely powerful weapon, however; the uncharged attack deals 200 damage and can be used to repeatedly hit a wide swath in front of the user. The charged swing takes around 2.5 seconds to fully power up, but is devastatingly strong, dealing 1200 damage while piercing armor like the Grizzco Slosher, making it capable of destroying almost any Boss Salmonid in one hit, regardless of whether or not they are in a normally vulnerable state; the slash is also able to destroy Maws that are still submerged. Like other splatana weapons, using the charged attack while moving forward causes the user to fly forward before swinging, and the Grizzco Splatana's lunge covers a considerable distance, so caution is advised when using it around ledges and enemies.

The Grizzco Splatana takes on the appearance of the Splatana Stamper. However, it has been modified to give it superior power, in exchange for the removal of its projectile-launching ability. In terms of aesthetic additions, the weapon features metal armatures along the blade and on the handle, as well as turnstiles on the center of the weapon, which resemble large engines, with what look like copper wires wound around small cylinders. There is orange tape all over the weapon. Finally, the grip is brown with the Grizzco logo in white, two yellow pill bottles with white caps, and a taped yellow underside.

The Grizzco Splatana is one of the rare weapons in Salmon Run Next Wave. It was first available on 2 December 2022 at  08:00 UTC.

- The Grizzco Splatana is a middleweight weapon.

- The Grizzco Splatana does not fire projectiles.

- The Grizzco Splatana can lunge forward if the user performs a charge slash while moving forward on the ground.

- The Grizzco Splatana cannot store its charge.

- The ink consumption of 3% per slash allows the user to slash 33 times per ink tank.

- After slashing, there is a 60 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- While slashing, the user's speed is set to 0.8 units per frame.

- The blade deals 200 damage per slash.

- The blade hitbox extends about 5.1 units in front of the user, and about 3.0 units to either side of the user.

- The time between continuous slashes is 30 frames.

- The user can submerge in ink 22 frames after the slash starts.

- The blade hitbox appears 5 frames after the slash starts.

- The ink consumption of 15% per slash allows the user to slash 6 times per ink tank.

- After slashing, there is a 135 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- While charging or slashing, the user's speed is set to 0.04 units per frame.

- The blade deals 1200 damage per slash.

- The blade hitbox extends about 5.4 units in front of the user, and about 0.5 units to either side of the user.

- It takes 78 frames to fully charge the weapon.

- The swing animation lasts for 60 frames.

- The user can submerge in ink 75 frames after the slash starts.

- The blade hitbox appears 18 frames after the slash starts.

- Lunges cover a distance of 9.0 units.

- After 16 frames of startup, the lunge lasts for 16 frames. The blade hitbox appears after 32 frames, and the projectile appears after 35 frames.
The total animation lasts for 60 frames, after which the weapon can be used again.
The user can submerge in ink 75 frames after the animation starts.
